section.title: Theory
section.p: Variables are containers for storing data values.
Variables can be used in expressions.

All variables must be indentified with unique names. Identifiers are case-sensitive in javascript.
In javascript '=' operator is an assignment operator, not an equal to operator.

section.title: Theory
section.p: Comparison operators are used to determine equality or difference between values or variables
